sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"碰撞"之意。
means: bump ： 主要指具体东西的有力碰撞，也可指碰到困难或障碍。
clash ： 指有力的或带有金属碰击声的打、敲或相互冲击。
collide ： 多指带毁坏性的猛烈相撞，也可指严重的直接冲突。
conflict ： 这个词以前可表具体东西的撞击，现在常指冲突或对立。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"冲击，碰撞"之意。
means: shock ： 指强烈冲击在肉体上或思想感情上所产生的效果。
impact ： 正式用词，侧重指物体相撞的结果或接触点。
collision ： 指物体相撞，其结果不是受损就是严重受阻。
clash ： 通常指两个或多个物体，特别是金属物发出刺耳声音或破裂声的撞击。也可引申指意见、利益等的冲突。

sentence.Network_en: The police said the clash was a sequel to yesterday'snationwide strike.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方说这场冲突是昨天全国大罢工的余波。

sentence.Network_en: They will televise both legs of Leeds' European Cup clash with Rangers.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧洲杯利兹联队与流浪者队的两场争夺战都将进行电视转播。

sentence.Network_en: Don't make any policy decisions which clash with official company thinking.
sentence.Network_cn: 所作的任何决策都不要和公司官方理念相冲突。

当冲撞乐队（The Clash）走上舞台的时候，观众们几乎快把嗓子喊哑了。在表演开场曲《伦敦在燃烧（London’s Burning）》的时候…
clarovitrain 亮煤质镜煤clash gear 滑动齿轮clash 碰撞声

entry.tran: 发生冲突;打斗;争论;意见不合
entry.def: When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other.

example.ex: A group of 400 demonstrators clashed with police...
example.tran: 400名示威者与警察发生了冲突。

example.ex: Behind the scenes, Parsons clashed with almost everyone on the show...
example.tran: 在幕后，帕森斯几乎和剧组的所有人都发生过冲突。

entry.tran: (信仰、观点、特性)相互冲突，相互抵触，不相容
entry.def: Beliefs, ideas, or qualities that clash with each other are very different from each other and therefore are opposed.

example.ex: Don't make any policy decisions which clash with official company thinking...
example.tran: 所作的任何决策都不要和公司官方理念相冲突。

example.ex: Here, morality and good sentiments clash headlong.
example.tran: 在这个问题上，道德和良知互不相容。

entry.def: If one event clashes with another, the two events happen at the same time so that you cannot attend both of them.

example.ex: The detective changed his holiday dates when his flight was brought forward and it now clashed with the trial.
example.tran: 由于航班提前，侦探更改了度假日期，但是这样一来就和审判冲突了。

entry.def: If one colour or style clashes with another, the colours or styles look ugly together. You can also say that two colours or styles clash .

example.ex: The red door clashed with the soft, natural tones of the stone walls...
example.tran: 红门和石墙柔和的自然色调不协调。

example.ex: So what if the colours clashed?
example.tran: 那么，要是色彩不搭怎么办？

entry.tran: (体育用语中尤用来指热情高涨的比赛双方)交锋，交手，厮杀
entry.def: Sports journalists sometimes say that two individuals or teams who compete against each other clash, especially when a lot of feeling is involved.

example.ex: Lewis has recently recovered his fitness and will clash with Christie in the 4x100m relay...
example.tran: 刘易斯近来恢复了状态，将在4×100米接力赛中和克里斯蒂一决雌雄。

example.ex: The two sides will clash there only if Chelsea beat Sunderland in their quarter-final replay.
example.tran: 只有切尔西队在四分之一决赛的重赛中击败桑德兰队，双方才会交锋。

entry.tran: (金属相互碰撞)发出当啷当啷声，发出撞击声
entry.def: When metal objects clash, they make a lot of noise by being hit together.

example.ex: The golden bangles on her arms clashed and jingled.
example.tran: 她手臂上的金手镯丁零当啷地响。

sentences.sentence: "he could hear the clang of distant bells"

sentences.sentence: "her dress was a disturbing clash of colors"

means.word_mean: 2. be incompatible; be or come into conflict;

sentences.en: The dustbins clashed as people emptied rubbish.
sentences.cn: 垃圾桶在人们倒垃圾时发出撞击声。

sentences.en: The pot came down on the stone floor with a clash.
sentences.cn: 锅“当”地一声掉到石地上。

sentences.en: The colour of the curtains has a clash with the colour of the wall.
sentences.cn: 窗帘的颜色与墙的颜色不协调。

sentences.en: There is a clash between two classes at 2 p.m.on Thursday.
sentences.cn: 星期四下午两点有两堂课是冲突的。

jushi.english: The pan clashed when it hit the stone floor.
jushi.chinese: 炒锅掉到石板地上发出刺耳的声音。

jushi.english: The dustbins clashed as people emptied rubbish.
jushi.chinese: 垃圾桶在人们倒垃圾时发出撞击声。
他们的剑当地一声碰在了一起。
